Bench Press.description: The bench press is a compound exercise that targets the chest muscles. Lie on a flat bench, lift the barbell, and lower it to your chest, then push it back up.

Incline Dumbbell Press.description: The incline dumbbell press targets the upper chest muscles. Lie on an inclined bench and press dumbbells upward, then lower them to chest level.

Dips.description: Dips are a compound exercise that works the chest and triceps. Use parallel bars, lower your body, and push it back up.

Tricep Pushdowns.description: Tricep pushdowns isolate the triceps. Use a cable machine, grip the bar with both hands, and push it downward, extending your arms.

Skull Crushers.description: Skull crushers target the triceps. Lie on a bench, hold a barbell, and lower it toward your forehead, then extend your arms.

Deadlift.description: The deadlift is a compound exercise that works the lower back, hamstrings, glutes, and more. Lift a loaded barbell from the ground to a standing position.

Pull-Ups.description: Pull-ups are a bodyweight exercise targeting the back and biceps. Hang from a bar and pull your body upward until your chin passes the bar.

Barbell Rows.description: Barbell rows are a compound exercise for the back. Bend at the hips, hold a barbell, and pull it to your lower ribcage, then lower it back down.

Bicep Curls.description: Bicep curls isolate the biceps. Hold dumbbells or a barbell, curl the weight toward your shoulders, and lower it back down.

Hammer Curls.description: Hammer curls also target the biceps. Hold dumbbells with a neutral grip and curl them toward your shoulders, then lower them.

Squats.description: Squats are a compound exercise that primarily target the quadriceps, hamstrings, and glutes. Bend your knees and hips to lower your body and then push back up to a standing position.

Leg Press.description: Leg press works the quadriceps, hamstrings, and glutes. Sit on a leg press machine and press the weight upward using your legs.

Romanian Deadlifts.description: Romanian deadlifts focus on the hamstrings and lower back. Hold a barbell or dumbbells and hinge at your hips while keeping your back straight, then return to a standing position.

Standing Calf Raises.description: Standing calf raises isolate the calf muscles. Stand on a calf raise machine or platform, lower your heels below the platform, and then raise them as high as possible.

Military Press.description: The military press, also known as the overhead press, targets the shoulders. Press a barbell or dumbbells from shoulder height to overhead, then lower it back down.

Lateral Raises.description: Lateral raises isolate the lateral deltoid muscles. Hold dumbbells at your sides and raise them out to the sides until shoulder level, then lower them.

Bent-Over Lateral Raises.description: Bent-over lateral raises target the rear deltoids. Bend at the hips, hold dumbbells, and raise them out to the sides while keeping your arms straight, then lower them.

Planks.description: Planks are an isometric exercise that strengthens the core. Support your body on your forearms and toes, keeping your body in a straight line from head to heels.

Bench Press.description: Bench press targets the chest muscles. Lie on a bench, lift the barbell, and lower it to your chest, then push it back up.

Incline Dumbbell Flyes.description: Incline dumbbell flyes target the upper chest. Lie on an inclined bench and perform flyes with dumbbells.

Chest Dips.description: Chest dips are a compound exercise that works the chest and triceps. Use parallel bars and lower your body, then push it back up.

Tricep Pushdowns.description: Tricep pushdowns isolate the triceps. Use a cable machine and push the bar downward, extending your arms.

Skull Crushers.description: Skull crushers target the triceps. Lie on a bench, hold a barbell, and lower it toward your forehead, then extend your arms.

Pull-Ups.description: Pull-ups are a bodyweight exercise targeting the back and biceps. Hang from a bar and pull your body upward until your chin passes the bar.

T-Bar Rows.description: T-bar rows are a compound exercise for the back. Bend at the hips, hold a handle, and pull it to your lower ribcage, then lower it back down.

Lat Pulldowns.description: Lat pulldowns work the upper back. Use a cable machine, grip the bar, and pull it down to your chest, then release it upward.

Bicep Curls.description: Bicep curls isolate the biceps. Hold dumbbells or a barbell, curl the weight toward your shoulders, and lower it back down.

Hammer Curls.description: Hammer curls also target the biceps. Hold dumbbells with a neutral grip and curl them toward your shoulders, then lower them.

Squats.description: Squats are a compound exercise that primarily target the quadriceps, hamstrings, and glutes. Bend your knees and hips to lower your body and then push back up to a standing position.

Leg Press.description: Leg press works the quadriceps, hamstrings, and glutes. Sit on a leg press machine and press the weight upward using your legs.

Lunges.description: Lunges target the quadriceps and glutes. Take a step forward, lunge, and return to the starting position, then switch legs.

Leg Curls.description: Leg curls isolate the hamstrings. Use a leg curl machine and curl your legs upward, then lower them back down.

Standing Calf Raises.description: Standing calf raises isolate the calf muscles. Stand on a calf raise machine or platform, lower your heels below the platform, and then raise them as high as possible.

Military Press.description: The military press, also known as the overhead press, targets the shoulders. Press a barbell or dumbbells from shoulder height to overhead, then lower it back down.

Lateral Raises.description: Lateral raises isolate the lateral deltoid muscles. Hold dumbbells at your sides and raise them out to the sides until shoulder level, then lower them.

Front Raises.description: Front raises target the front deltoids. Hold dumbbells and raise them forward until shoulder level, then lower them.

Bent-Over Lateral Raises.description: Bent-over lateral raises focus on the rear deltoids. Bend at the hips, hold dumbbells, and raise them out to the sides while keeping your arms straight, then lower them.

Ab Crunches.description: Ab crunches target the core muscles. Lie on your back, bend your knees, and curl your upper body off the ground toward your thighs, then lower it back down.

Cardio.description: Engage in 20-30 minutes of high-intensity interval training (HIIT) on a treadmill, stationary bike, or elliptical machine for cardiovascular conditioning.

Russian Twists.description: Russian twists engage the core. Sit on the ground, hold a weight or medicine ball, and twist your torso to each side.

Face Pulls.description: Face pulls target the rear deltoids and upper back. Use a rope attachment on a cable machine, pull the rope towards your face, and squeeze your shoulder blades together.
